channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：TikTok 动员其约 1.7 亿美国用户大军游说国会，反对要求出售 TikTok 的法案。这一噱头可能适得其反。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: TikTok mobilized its army of some 170 million American users to lobby Congress against a bill to require its sale. The stunt may have backfired.https://t.co/OpYtxpSIwE

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 在接受 @JoannaStern 的独家专访时，OpenAI 首席技术官米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）解释了公司新推出的 Sora 人工智能视频工具及其推广计划。
item.description:
In an exclusive interview with @JoannaStern, OpenAI CTO Mira Murati explains the company’s new Sora AI video tool and how it plans to roll it out https://t.co/e5mxXVEmRT https://t.co/e5mxXVEmRT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 治疗师在你哭泣时对你竖起的大拇指。气球打断公司董事会。这是苹果一项引发混乱的功能的一部分。

item.title: 你会花 65 美元购买香奈儿除臭剂吗？我们试用了 4 款名牌止汗剂，看看它们是否比药店的主打产品更胜一筹。

item.title: 宅在家里的闺蜜们在 TikTok 上上传了大量关于自我保健、烹饪、清洁的视频，以及对传统婚姻的理想化憧憬--少了结婚戒指
item.description:
Stay-at-home girlfriends have flooded TikTok with videos of self-care, cooking, cleaning and an idealized vision of a traditional marriage—minus the wedding ring https://t.co/Cmqu5CN4Rl https://t.co/Cmqu5CN4Rl

item.title: Vanguard 表示，去年有创纪录比例的 401（k）账户持有人因财务紧急状况而提前从账户中提款
item.description:

item.title: 看到朋友离婚或考虑离婚，这位《青年钱报》专栏作家不得不认真思考自己的感情问题

item.title: 租车意味着每天花费高达 80 或 100 美元（如果你能找到一辆车的话）的日子一去不复返了。"这是旅行中为数不多的能让消费者真正享受到价格优惠的领域之一"。
item.description:
Gone are the days where renting a car meant spending upward of $80 or $100 a day—if you could even find a car. “It's one of the few areas in travel where there's actually a little bit of price relief for the consumer.” https://t.co/tPwc93Qgg2 https://t.co/tPwc93Qgg2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: "我太年轻了，不适合变老"。人们不遗余力地减少或阻止白发苍苍的过程。一些研究衰老问题的科学家认为，他们可能有所发现。
item.description:
“I’m too young to be old.” People are going to great lengths to reduce or halt the graying process. Some scientists of aging think they might be onto something. https://t.co/I7hcvPNbHt https://t.co/I7hcvPNbHt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 今年的大学招生可谓 "一团糟"。联邦财政补助申请、考试要求和平权法案的变化带来了混乱。
item.description:
College admissions is a “hot mess” this year. Changes to the federal financial-aid application, testing requirements and affirmative action have sown chaos. https://t.co/JSYxwdR7mS https://t.co/JSYxwdR7mS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@BradOnMessage 写道：十年来，民主党在美国参议院从未如此脆弱，但共和党的捐赠者和我们的华盛顿天才们似乎都在关注席位数量的减少。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Democrats haven’t been this vulnerable in the U.S. Senate in a decade, yet GOP donors and our Washington geniuses seem to be focusing on a shrinking number of seats, writes @BradOnMessage https://t.co/Lpl1VkTrsC

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 他们认为自己最平庸的想法都是绝妙的，忽略了自己正在挣扎的迹象，把纠正当成建议。
item.description:
They think their most banal ideas are brilliant, ignore signs that they’re struggling and treat corrections like suggestions.

Your co-worker is lousy—and doesn’t even know it. https://t.co/PHZneeU8dU https://t.co/PHZneeU8dU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 大麻现在在大约二十几个州合法用于娱乐，许多人都在考虑何时才能安全驾驶。以下是研究人员和医生的看法。
item.description:

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 南卡罗来纳州的一对夫妇聘请设计师莉尔丝-麦肯纳（Lilse McKenna）将家中使用率不高的屏风门廊改造成真正的生活空间，他们的设计理念很明确：一个超级实用、全年开放的家庭室，同时又不牺牲风格
item.description:
When a South Carolina couple hired designer Lilse McKenna to turn their home's underused screened-in porch into real living space, the brief was clear: A super-practical, year-round family room that doesn't sacrifice style https://t.co/F4bkSR5ZL6 https://t.co/F4bkSR5ZL6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 一个多世纪以来，社会一直认为反社会病症是不可治疗和不可救赎的。经过多年的研究和深入治疗，我可以说反社会者并不 "坏"、"邪恶 "或 "疯狂"。我们的行为是为了填补空虚，帕特里克-加涅写道。
item.description:
For more than a century, society has deemed sociopathy untreatable and unredeemable. After years of study and intensive therapy, I can say that sociopaths aren’t “bad” or “evil” or “crazy.” We act out to fill a void, writes Patric Gagne. https://t.co/DBvyuOl4es pic.twitter.com/tuWdlJ7OQF

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 著名现代主义建筑师约瑟夫-埃舍利克（Joseph Esherick）在加利福尼亚州设计的一栋房屋自近 70 年前建成以来首次进入市场。
item.description:
A California house by the renowned modernist architect Joseph Esherick is coming on the market for the first time since it was built nearly 70 years ago https://t.co/GsATJi31f9 https://t.co/GsATJi31f9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 一对夫妇买下了自家后院不远处的一栋破旧楼房，至今已有多年。他们意识到，如果再拖延下去，这栋楼就会倒塌。
item.description:
It has been years since one couple purchased a dilapidated building just beyond their backyard. Finally they set to work, aware that if they delayed much longer it could simply fall down. https://t.co/9ImPcl6uhN https://t.co/9ImPcl6uhN
